text: I've run strands in the gitrekt monster, and I like it a lot. As long as your land recursion is thick and you have the means to search out Urborg, which that deck would have generally in the first place.
Then again, my gitrog did tend to ramp pretty hard so that cmc wasn't much of an issue.
Boyfriend had a Lazav deck and I made him take it apart. I hated that thing with a passion. It was a retarded mill deck and he'd always targeted me because I have an abundance of eldrazi >.>
As for gitrog, I got ptsd from that toad because a few friends made it and they just play solitaire with it lol

Yeah that's what prompted me to take him apart.  I've mained both Meren and Gitrog for Golgari and out of the two Gitrog felt the most solitaire-y (<-not a word, don't care).  I now main Meren and have considered swapping over to {{Glissa, the Traitor}} because that's what I have built on MTGO and it's a blast to play.  It flies under the radar more often than not and has some really strong synergy.

Don did a parse once to see which commanders had the least variance among decks. Obviously most in the top 20 were precons because people just uploading their entire precon or barely altered precon skews those results. Most of thee rest were tribal decks, because when you're playing Grafwidow spiders or whatever it's pretty easy to pick the same 20 dudes as everyone else
The one commander not a precon or a tribal commander? Gitrog
That really puts it into perspective Dana.  Overall I felt like Meren had more build flexibility.  Gitrog has so few flex slots if you're actually trying to win with him.
It's what most folks complain about with Gitrog - he's a linear build that durdles to the nth degree
His combo is pretty sweet though, not many combos work in the clean up step like that
I really like Gitrog as a concept. It's super unique

I've played Meren quite a bit, so I feel like it's time to retire her. Once my playgroups start to get the roll-eyes when I pull a deck out it usually cues me that my build for that guild/wedge/whatever needs to get shifted for the sake of diversity.
But that's the point "His combo"...because he has the one.
But when building him the deck design and play tends to be pretty on rails
Yeah, if it wasn't so narrow I would enjoy him more.
Yuppers, why I ultimately never put him together
It was a fun month while I was playing that same game over and over again, until it got boring.
Vs something like Glissa. Matt and I compared our Glissa decks once and we had like 11 non-land cards in common
She has a surprising amount of diversity available.
Sure - glissa just wants to kill things, which leaves the details pretty open.
Oh.... shatter gang rats..... hm....

I’ve got a non-combo Gitrog deck and it always feels like the slipperiest deck I️ own. I️ have like 18 different ways to win, from landfall tokens to landfall lifeloss to psychosis crawler to just a straight-up exaanguinate. It’s hard to get backed into a corner, there’s always a way out
[[shattergang]]

attachments.fallback: Shattergang Brothers {1}{B}{R}{G} // Legendary Creature — Goblin Artificer // {2}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Each other player sacrifices a creature. // {2}{R}, Sacrifice an artifact: Each other player sacrifices an artifact. // {2}{G}, Sacrifice an enchantment: Each other player sacrifices an enchantment. // 3/3
attachments.text:

text: Yeah, Frog probably plays pretty well just as Golgari goodstuff
That’s how I️ feel about Meren actually (I️ have both)
That's rather the point of 'goodstuff'..you just need a general with the colors.
Shattergang rats sounds interesting enough.  I like the idea of a utility Gitrog deck.  Sounds like it would really smokescreen the opponents.
I️ could honestly play only Golgari commanders for the rest of time and I’d be happy. They have the most diversity in legendary creatures hands down
I couldn't agree more, but I am heavily biased towards Golgari, or anything backboned off of Golgari.
Man, I don’t know how people can add a third color to a rats deck to be honest... there isn’t enough room for it
There is barely enough room for 2
Also, Shattergang Bros's ability is pretty mana/color intensive if you actually plan to use it.
Not sure what Red brings to rats
Yeah, that's his biggest issue.
More haste!
At least white would yield access to Orzhov, which puts you on some of the strongest and most efficient removal.
Allows you to cast rats and answer things.
And [[warstorm surge]]

attachments.fallback: Warstorm Surge {5}{R} // Enchantment // Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, it deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.
attachments.text:
Enchantment
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, it deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.
_"Listen to the roar! Feel the thunder! The Immersturm shouts its approval with every bolt of lightning!"_
attachments.title: Warstorm Surge {5}{R}

text: Oh baby... that escalation of thrumming rats sounds hilarious
6 mana before you go off with rats? That goes against the deck's build.
<@U3MTJRAQL> 100% agree. Gitrog, Meren, Glissa, Ishkanah, Varolz, even mono-GB Reyhan is great. Hapatra...
Thrumming Stone rats does seem good, but I agree with <@U3L7A68JC>.
I feel like we just would rather be on our gameplan without so much mana intensive setup.
My build barely does the thrumming stone stuff anymore Henry, it’s a win con like anything else
Anyone who's played against a rat deck before will kill you before you get to that point.
Rat's can't go slow
They can! Just not... the slowest
Or just play [[Spreading Plague]] and watch the rats die...

attachments.fallback: Spreading Plague {4}{B} // Enchantment // Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, destroy all other creatures that share a color with it. They can't be regenerated.
attachments.text:
Enchantment
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, destroy all other creatures that share a color with it. They can't be regenerated.
_The cruelest strain of plague keeps its hosts alive long enough to return home and infect their families._
attachments.title: Spreading Plague {4}{B}

text: I can't speak to anyone else's meta, but my meta has a fair amount of targeted hate towards tribal decks.  Especially after the recent wave of precons.
I’ve had my rats deck for like 4 years now and still not targeted hate
There's so many altered precons of various stages running around that even if they don't have card specific answers, they will just target you and run at you until you're not an issue anymore.
Well then it sounds like you're completely free to do whatever then.
Pretty much
In that case build it [[Xira Arien]].  That'll really mess with them.

text: I run it in one deck.
It's in my sultai build.
I have several, but until recently in most games it became a 5-cost non-targeted destroy that creature.
I could see that.
For me [[Aligned Hedron Network]] was the one I thought would see more play when it released.

text: It is a good card, especially if your meta is stocked with stompy decks.
It even plays well with blink/bounce.
I think I ran it in Brago for a time
Yea, I grabbed a few when those were bulky bulk because it's too good not to have. My buddy's Karador deck gets hosed by that card super hard
Ouch, that seems like a pretty good counter to that deck.
It's a 0.25¢ now
Yeah, I traded for like 6 foils when the set was getting drafted a lot because they were trading at the $1 mark.
I figured eventually the foil of that card will be a decent amount above $1.  It's relevant enough.
Seems great in tribal elves or goblins and the like
I run it in alesha.
It keeps people from going too far above me.
[[meekstone]] does work in those kinda decks too

text: Yeah I'm currently looking for an invention of that.
Best nickname for Aligned Hedron Network: “Ula Hoop”
That's pretty awesome.
Solid
It seemed to me they were engaged in a game of duck, duck, eldrazi.
This seems like something good in a 'need a fast game' deck: [[Crumbling Sanctuary]]

Oh it would be completely in a fast punishment deck that deals damage for breathing.
No I️ hear ya... but how is that faster than dealing 40 damage?
I was just thinking of a [[Heartless Hidetsugu]] deck using Crumbling Sanctuary]]
